text: Few known genes ( <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , members of the IL-8 family , <extra_id_0> interferon-gamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) are induced in T cells only through the combined effect of phorbol myristic acetate ( PMA ) and a Ca ( 2+ ) - ionophore , and expression of only these genes can be fully suppressed by Cyclosporin A ( CyA ) .

text: We have identified a putative transcription factor , designated <extra_id_0> PILOT <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , with an identical dual signal requirement for expression .

text: Induction of the <extra_id_0> PILOT <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene is detectable in human T cells 20 min following activation in the presence of cycloheximide and is fully suppressed by CyA .

text: The <extra_id_0> PILOT <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> protein has a calculated M ( r ) of 42.6 kDa and contains three zinc fingers of the C2H2-type at the carboxyl-terminus which are highly homologous to the zinc finger regions of the transcription factors <extra_id_0> EGR1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> EGR2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and <extra_id_0> pAT 133 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
In contrast to T cells , in fibroblasts <extra_id_0> PILOT <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene expression requires only one signal ( PMA ) and is not affected by CyA .

text: This observation directly demonstrates the existence of a Ca2+ signal - dependent regulatory element obligatory for expression of some genes in T cells but not in fibroblasts .
This differential expression model will be valuable in the dissection of the dual signal pathway in T cells and the effects of CyA upon it .
